thread.title: The Sculptor Who Imagined George Washington as a Roman God

author: Charles Passy
title: The Sculptor Who Imagined George Washington as a Roman God
text:
The Frick Collection would like to show you George Washington as youâ€™ve never seen him before.
Think Roman god, with an expression of deep contemplation and an athletic physique, garbed in a flowing cloak and open-toed shoes.
The image comes courtesy of the Italian neoclassical sculptor Antonio Canova (1757-1822), whose rendering of the first... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
